entry.title: Keyaki Bridge・欅橋
entry.content:
Wandered around inside the Kyoto Imperial Palace grounds for the first time in almost 10 years. The palace itself (The Emperor‘s Kyoto residence) is set inside the Palace Park. A tour reservation used to be required to visit, but now the palace grounds can be entered without either a reservation or tour.

Above is the Keyakibashi Bridge: a small footbridge within the Oikeniwa pond garden. Below, some other photos of the palace grounds.

約10年ぶりに京都御所の敷地内をぶらぶらしました。京都御所（天皇陛下のお住まい）は、御所公園内にあります。以前はツアーの予約が必要でしたが、今は予約もツアーもなく、敷地内に入ることができます。

上の写真は、御池庭園の中にある小さな歩道橋「欅橋」です。以下、御所地内の他の写真。
entry.summary: Wandered around inside the Kyoto Imperial Palace grounds for the first time in almost 10 years. The palace itself (The Emperor‘s Kyoto residence) is set inside the Palace Park. A tour reservation used to be required to visit, but now the palace grounds can be entered without either a reservation or tour. Above is the Keyakibashi Bridge: a small footbridge within the Oikeniwa pond garden. Below, some other photos of the palace grounds.

entry.title: Ohara Water・大原の水
entry.content:
Water basin at Hosen-in Temple in Ohara, in the mountains north of Kyoto.

Below is the Otonashi Waterfall, and the Ritsukawa River that the waterfall feeds into.

京都の北の山間部、大原にある宝泉院にある水盤。

下の写真は、音無の滝と津川です。

entry.title: Oi River・大堰川
entry.content:
Came out after the rain and was treated to blue skies with big white clouds. I was able to get the clouds to reflect in the river by walking out onto the exposed riverbed.

雨上がりに出てみると、青空に大きな白い雲を見ることができました。川底を歩いて、雲を川に映すことができた。
entry.summary: Came out after the rain and was treated to blue skies with big white clouds. I was able to get the clouds to reflect in the river by walking out onto the exposed riverbed.

entry.title: Kamogawa Delta・鴨川デルタ
entry.content:
At the very tip of the Kamogawa Delta (confluence of Kamo and Takano Rivers), a long exposure blurs the movement of the water on a rainy day.

長時間露光で水の動きをぼかす。 鴨川と高野川の合流点、鴨川デルタの先端で撮影。
entry.summary: At the very tip of the Kamogawa Delta (confluence of Kamo and Takano Rivers), a long exposure blurs the movement of the water on a rainy day.

entry.title: Seasonal Sashimi・季節の刺身
entry.content:
A dish in celebration of Children’s Day (May 5th), at Arashiyama’s Nishiki restaurant.

On the red plate, clockwise from top: carp sashimi (the koinobori fish flags flown for children's day are carp), white daikon radish, garlic, nori, cucumber, with a shiso flower garnish. Served with a vinegar miso dressing (left). A long iris leaf, dressed with a gold and silver knot, completes the seasonal setting.

嵐山「錦」のこどもの日（5月5日）にちなんだ一品です。

赤い皿の上から時計回りに、鯉の刺身（子供の日に掲げられる鯉のぼりは鯉）、大根、ニンニク、海苔、キュウリ、シソの花を添えている。酢味噌ドレッシングでいただきます（左）。金銀の結び目をあしらった長いの葉が、季節感のあるセッティングを完成させています。

entry.title: Ota Jinja・大田神社
entry.content:
The Kakitsubata iris field at Ota Jinja has been blooming for a millennia, and is a Japanese National Treasure. There was a tanka poem written about these irises in the Heian Era, 9th Century.

大田神社のかきつばた畑は、1000年以上前から咲いているそうです。
entry.summary: The Kakitsubata iris field at Ota Jinja has been blooming for a millennia, and is a Japanese National Treasure. There was a tanka poem written about these irises in the Heian Era, 9th Century.

entry.title: Parallel Worlds
entry.content:
Two photos of women in their native dress by Yuriko Takagi are displayed on the grounds of Nijo Castle, as part of the 2023 Kyotographie exhibition.

Additional photos from top/left: More photos on exhibit, looking through a castle door at photos, castle staff closing the Ninomaru Palace door, castle staff raking the pebbles in front of the East Otemon Gate.

二条城の敷地内に、2023年国際写真祭「Kyotographie」の一環として、高木由利子の民族衣装姿の女性写真2点が展示されています。

上/左から追加写真： 展示写真の追加、城の扉から写真を見る、二の丸御殿の扉を閉める、東大手門の前で小石をかき集める。
